list.desc: A sequence of bullet points ("item") organized as a list.

valItem.desc: each list item glosses some term or concept, which is given by a label element preceding the list item. 목록의 각 항목은 선행하는 요소에서 제시된 용어 또는 개념에 대한 설명이다. 各列表項目為一些字詞或概念下註解，每個項目之前並帶有標籤元素。 cada item de la lista glosa algun término o concepto de los que han sido dados por un elemento de la lista de la etiqueta que precede. リスト項目は，当該リスト項目に先行してあるラベル要素で示され たある用語や意義をまとめたものである． chaque item de la liste commente un terme ou un concept qui est donné par un élément label précédant l'item de la liste. ogni voce dell'elenco è la glossa di un termine o concetto dato da un elemento legenda che precede la voce stessa jeder Listenpunkt erläutert einen Begriff oder ein Konzept, das von einem voranstehenden label-Element genannt wird.

each list item is an entry in an index such as the alphabetical topical index at the back of a print volume. jeder Listenpunkt ist ein Registereintrag z. B. in einem alphabetisch geordneten Sachregister am Ende einer Druckausgabe.
each list item is a step in a sequence of instructions, as in a recipe. jeder Listenpunkt ist ein Arbeitsschritt in einer Folge von Anweisungen, wie z. B. in einem Rezept.

each list item is one of a sequence of petitions, supplications or invocations, typically in a religious ritual. jeder Listenpunkt ist Teil einer Reihenfolge von Gebeten, Bitten oder Anrufungen die üblicherweise in einem religiösen Ritual verwendet werden.

each list item is part of an argument consisting of two or more propositions and a final conclusion derived from them. jeder Listenpunkt ist Teil eines Arguments, das aus zwei oder mehr Prämissen und einem daraus gezogenen Schluss besteht.

valItem.ident: Contract of employment of a scribe

locus.desc: Specify range of folios of a text within the manuscript.

quote.desc: Transcribe relevant portion of the text. Specify language and script of the document.

ab.desc: Provide a translation of the relevant portion of the text.

relation.desc: Specify the relationship between the person and another person or object. Choose the kind of relation from the list provided. Create and use fields for "Subject", "Object", and "Mutual" as indicated in the relation description. Additional "Mutual" fields can be created at your discretion.

valItem.attLabel: [Mutual] and [Mutual] have a family relationship with each other
[Mutual] and [Mutual] are kin of each other
[Mutual] and [Mutual] have claimed a family relationship with each other
[Mutual] and [Mutual] are the family of each other
[Mutual] and [Mutual] are the discilinary associates of each other
[Mutual] and [Mutual] are acquainted with each other

mutual.desc: Use the lookup to reference entities that have a mutual relation.

active.desc: Use the lookup to reference the subject in the relation.

passive.desc: Use the lookup to reference the object in the relation.

desc.desc: contains a brief description of the object documented by its parent element, typically a documentation element or an entity.

gloss.desc: Give a brief account of the relation you are describing, including the names of all the persons, places and objects involved.

persName.desc: Look up the person records in the database. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. Add additional persons as required.

placeName.desc: Look up the place records. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. The place given here refers to the acquisition (and not the production of the copy).

idno.desc: Specify the shelfmark of a manuscript section.

valItem.desc: International Standard Book Number: a 13- or (if assigned prior to 2007) 10-digit identifying number assigned by the publishing industry to a published book or similar item, registered with the International ISBN Agency.
International Standard Serial Number: an eight-digit number to uniquely identify a serial publication.
Digital Object Identifier: a unique string of letters and numbers assigned to an electronic document.
Uniform Resource Identifier: a string of characters to uniquely identify a resource which usually contains indication of the means of accessing that resource, the name of its host, and its filepath.
A data number in the Virtual Internet Authority File assigned to link different names in catalogs around the world for the same entity.
English Short-Title Catalogue number: an identifying number assigned to a document in English printed in the British Isles or North America before 1801.
OCLC control number (record number) for the union catalog record in WorldCat, a union catalog for member libraries in the Online Computer Library Center global cooperative.

title.desc: Use the lookup to search for the title of the work.

date.desc: Fill in the date in CE. The date refers to the acquisition (not the production of the copy).
